head.title: More to Say on 'Pursuit of Less'; Apply New Rules To the Big Umbrella

hedline.hl1: More to Say on 'Pursuit of Less'; Apply New Rules To the Big Umbrella

abstract.p: David Koch letter on September 3 article expresses hope that new billboard guidelines will be retroactively enforceable against giant red umbrella that overs over TriBeCa, West Village and Hudson (S)

block.p: Re ''Is That Sky Behind the Billboards? New Zoning Rules Are Proposed'' (Sept. 3): One can only hope that the new guidelines currently under consideration by the City Planning Commission will be retroactively enforceable to bring down one of the most egregious trespasses committed against the Manhattan skyline, the giant red umbrella that hovers over TriBeCa, the West Village and the Hudson.

Re ''Is That Sky Behind the Billboards? New Zoning Rules Are Proposed'' (Sept. 3): One can only hope that the new guidelines currently under consideration by the City Planning Commission will be retroactively enforceable to bring down one of the most egregious trespasses committed against the Manhattan skyline, the giant red umbrella that hovers over TriBeCa, the West Village and the Hudson.

The garish neon sign, stealthily erected, could easily be relocated to Times Square, its spiritual birthplace, along with most of the other vinyl, plastic and apartment-shaped commercial assaults that currently proliferate across the city. We're fortunate we have such a place for crassness to call home; gigantic corporate statements, hither!
